title: Prepare release 0.11.0
body: Would you please cut a new release? (I need it for https://github.com/rusticata/x509-parser/pull/100)

title: Fix rustdoc.
body: The rustdoc build links to the Validate trait, but that is only available when the validate feature is set.  If rustdoc is run without that feature, it will error due to deny(broken_intra_doc_links).  This changes the comment so that it only links to that trait if the feature is set.

title: Extend the lifetimes exposed on TbsCertificate
body: This makes it possible for me to use the extension accessors introduced in v0.10.

title: Added ReasonFlags struct for CRLDistributionPoints extension
body:
Before CRLDistributionPoints gets released, added ReasonFlags which works similar to other flag structures like NSCertType.

Note, the tests are still commented due to an issue with openssl certificates #97

title: [Draft] Added tests for CRLDistributionPoints extension
body:
Hello, I've been looking into adding CRLDistributionPoints parser, so thanks a lot for adding it in 33d2cdc - makes my life easier (: 

I've had a few tests to ensure the extension is parsed correctly, but for some reason `reason` and `issuer` fields are not getting parsed correctly: in the [`crl-complex.der`](https://lapo.it/asn1js/#_CXaoQOHdvbs6CGfIJuYGzMNTOQ-gIh4w822FgL9bqIdmBKBRLm_0Na_LzxbFsDXZDaPNH_TPNGOwBpiyqwsOwP04pVVJbJlo27-05c1Ctt9VwRKBnOanVzm0FXXO0nrWHFlunMg1QOCru_kRsW8Gfc-ISSorE29Iys7wSIul439dzAAjT1sjpan7OcLlOPIievPKJRcSImaidi2GKXBTrcqjZvZE-qC_vGaTR0YA1IwKHZeFbv8Qj-Ihkv9wCtHqnXexQIDAQABo4HLMIHIMAsGA1UdDwQEAwIEsDAdBgNVHSUEFjAUBggrBgEFBQcDAQYIKwYBBQUHAwIwgZkGA1UdHwSBkTCBjjBkoB-gHYYbaHR0cDovL2V4YW1wbGUuY29tL215Y2EuY3JsgQMHYICiPKQ6MDgxCzAJBgNVBAYTAlVTMRUwEwYDVQQKDAxPcmdhbmlzYXRpb24xEjAQBgNVBAMMCVNvbWUgTmFtZTAmoCCgHoYcaHR0cDovL2V4YW1wbGUuY29tL215Y2EyLmNybIECBWAwDQYJKoZIhvcNAQELBQADggEBANrgEfdUj_AlO7LtJaIlL44Zc1uz7X_pXUiRXYIeIQNwUayWLnaQ_8BlzgNwRHdNOMd72YolyRa4NRxDgmFVpDj6-hAbn43QcTmO5nOgAHtsDpSnY2YavDvsWQIFKVjjzSfMP8f8mDl6Qze-kzDC8o1gECjSSSoei3iTDFlibryvfzdeUs6EGPR94mIL_Vv96hxCwigM3ikkdfx5CC9HGlc1oyQnxS5CBT5fIcJHAtWiXyHHrTPF1oboSEf4ReUXpakBKj6iZs7Yh5dsu5f4YnyzzTTdB2NWBJMgJ5CMTYr3I4rKLiq0vefzN48qsE_jexGJ9y8uljBVZBE05q34YBM) both `reason` and `issuer` are none, while `openssl x509` is able to parse them:

```

                  Key Compromise, CA Compromise

    Signature Algorithm: sha256WithRSAEncryption
         da:e0:11:f7:54:8f:f0:25:3b:b2:ed:25:a2:25:2f:8e:19:73:
         5b:b3:ed:7f:e9:5d:48:91:5d:82:1e:21:03:70:51:ac:96:2e:

         02:05:29:58:e3:cd:27:cc:3f:c7:fc:98:39:7a:43:37:be:93:
         30:c2:f2:8d:60:10:28:d2:49:2a:1e:8b:78:93:0c:59:62:6e:
         bc:af:7f:37:5e:52:ce:84:18:f4:7d:e2:62:0b:fd:5b:fd:ea:
         1c:42:c2:28:0c:de:29:24:75:fc:79:08:2f:47:1a:57:35:a3:
         24:27:c5:2e:42:05:3e:5f:21:c2:47:02:d5:a2:5f:21:c7:ad:
         33:c5:d6:86:e8:48:47:f8:45:e5:17:a5:a9:01:2a:3e:a2:66:
         ce:d8:87:97:6c:bb:97:f8:62:7c:b3:cd:34:dd:07:63:56:04:
         93:20:27:90:8c:4d:8a:f7:23:8a:ca:2e:2a:b4:bd:e7:f3:37:
         8f:2a:b0:4f:e3:7b:11:89:f7:2f:2e:96:30:55:64:11:34:e6:
         ad:f8:60:13
```

The certs were generated via openssl:
```
openssl req -x509 -nodes -days 36500 -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout /dev/null -out crl-complex.der -outform DER -config configs/crl-complex.cfg -extensions 'v3_req'

cat configs/crl-complex.cfg
[req]
distinguished_name = req_distinguished_name
x509_extensions = v3_req
prompt = no

[req_distinguished_name]
C = US
O = Organisation
CN = Some Name

[v3_req]
keyUsage = keyEncipherment, digitalSignature, dataEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage = serverAuth,clientAuth
crlDistributionPoints = crldp1_section, crldp2_section

[crldp1_section]
fullname = URI:http://example.com/myca.crl
CRLissuer = dirName:issuer_sect
reasons = keyCompromise, CACompromise, AACompromise

[crldp2_section]
fullname = URI:http://example.com/myca2.crl
reasons = keyCompromise, CACompromise

[issuer_sect]
C = US
O = Organisation
CN = Some Name
```

I've been trying to figure this out for a few days now and I thought if you have any ideas, as I'm not as familiar with ASN.1/BER/DER.

title: Add Ed25519 as an signature algorithm.
body: Should fix #71. I did test that using a custom certificate made using the rcgen crate. Sadly my OpenSSL installation can't generate Ed25519 signed certificates.

title: Use correct lifetime for iter return values.
Fix certificate validity period check
body: According to RFC #5280 4.1.2.5, "the validity period for a certificate is the period of time from notBefore through notAfter, inclusive." At present, `is_valid_at` treats `notAfter` as exclusive. This commit fixes the issue by treating `notAfter` as inclusive.

title: fix: X509Name::iter_state_or_province OID value
body:
Hi! Thanks for writing an maintaining this project, it's made the certificate manipulation work I've had to do for a recent project much easier 😁 .

I hit a slight issue using [`X509Name::iter_state_or_province`](https://github.com/rusticata/x509-parser/blob/0b7e17ef7def4b5d4ed685cb85a30c0a8f689b17/src/x509.rs#L317) today, in that it currently pulls the certificate street address instead of the state or province name as suggested by the method name.

It looks like this mismatch between `X509Name::iter_state_or_province` and its OID value was caused in the switch to `oid-registry` in ddb9ac8287a3284534754c133fc1fd0507ac84f2.

Before the switch `X509Name::iter_state_or_province` used `&OID_ST` which was defined as `2.5.4.8`, but when using values from `oid-registry` it uses the constant `&OID_X509_STREET_ADDRESS` which is defined as `2.5.4.9`.

This corrects the OID value to use the constant `&OID_X509_STATE_OR_PROVINCE_NAME` from `oid-registry` so that it pulls the correct data from the certificate.

title: CSR signature verification should take no arguments (fixes #66)
Improve code locality (fixes #60)
body:
Here's an attempt at redistributing code in certificate/revocation_list/certification_request modules, leaving shared stuff in x509. Pretty much all parsers live right next to their type definitions, if they have one.

With the exception of the extensions module, I think module sizes are pretty manageable. (extensions was at 935 lines before, so it was already large.)

```
 File                                              Lines         Code     Comments       Blanks
 ./src/error.rs                                      105           82            9           14
 ./src/x509.rs                                       486          347           94           45
 ./src/lib.rs                                        169           41          122            6
 ./src/certificate.rs                                474          288          149           37
 ./src/revocation_list.rs                            288          173           92           23
 ./src/time.rs                                       166          131           18           17
 ./src/pem.rs                                        173           79           84           10
 ./src/certification_request.rs                      159          110           41            8
 ./src/cri_attributes.rs                             139          118            6           15
 ./src/objects.rs                                     67           46           15            6
 ./src/extensions.rs                                1103          868          167           68
```
